article.para: Depending on your needs, you can either download precompiled jar files of the FlyMine distribution, or build these yourself from source.

sect1.title: Obtaining the source code
sect1.para: The source code can be obtained via a download, or via anonymous CVS.

sect2.title: Downloading the source code
sect2.para: The source code or a jar file containing precompiled classes can be downloaded as either an official release, or a nightly snapshot. The source code is available in tar.gz or ZIP format.
Official releases - these are the official FlyMine releases. Official releases happen every couple of months, on average.

Nightly dump - this is an up-to-the-minute snapshot of the FlyMine source code, as it was last night. This will work, but may be in a state of flux, and with portions undocumented, or not conforming to the documentation.

sect1.title: Building FlyMine
sect1.para: The only pre-requisite for building FlyMine is Ant. This should be downloaded and installed on your machine.

itemizedlist.listitem: Issue the command ant jar (if building from source). This will create a file flymine.jar in the dist directory.
Copy the file flymine.jar to a directory on your classpath

Write a program using the FlyMine Query API! This will automatically contact the main FlyMine servers. Many things are configurable by having a file flymine.properties in your classpath (earlier than flymine.jar). An example flymine.properties can be found in the jar file.

sect2.title: Building a FlyMine server
sect2.para: FlyMine defines a number of datasources which are used during building of the integrated database. These need to be installed locally in order to be used.

itemizedlist.listitem: Edit the file flymine.properties, changing the locations of servers and datasources to match your local site. This file is commented so should be self-explainatory.
Issue the command ant build-db to build the integrated database. This may take a very long time to complete, depending on the number of datasources configured.
